Chris Chafe is head of a labor federation called Change to Win.
He says cutting jobs and wages could have disastrous consequences down the road.
Look at what happened in Japan during the 1990s.
They never pulled themselves out of recession there because they did not feed the most valuable drivers of consumer purchasing, which is workers.
So what we see happening in the lay-offs and the wage cuts we believe actually is just following the worst possible model.

Because if we continue to cut jobs in this country, if we continue to cut wages, we're actually taking money out of the pockets of the people who are going to spend that money and help drive our recovery.

No, that's right.

We think that if we follow this path we are literally digging an even deeper hole for ourselves on a collective basis.
